user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I was super excited to finally try a multiple use product, but this left me disappointed. The color is very sheer. It showed on my eyelids well, but as blush I had to put on about 3 applications for the color to be more pronounced. But the deal breaker was putting it on my lips. It felt dry and chalky on my lips, was incredibly sheer and almost looked cartoonish as I applied more layers to build color. I would be considered "deep" under the Sephora complexion profile, but I was suprised that I had to do so much for so little "pop". Disappointed, but will try other colors down the road.

review_content:
I can't believe I slept on this for so long. This is officially the blush that will always be in my makeup bag. By far the smoothest, easiest-to-apply cream blush I've tried, and it's so easy to keep it very natural looking (which I find more difficult with the powder version) or ramp up the color if you want it to be bolder. The shimmer is absolutely perfect - it's not over-the-top, more of a glow than a shimmer, and I don't need to apply highlighter when I wear this. Overall, completely worth the hype and will repurchase forever.

I want the multiple in every color!!! It has been a staple in my makeup collection for a very long time now. Forty dollars sounds like a lot at first, but the multiple is named that for a reason, and that is that it has multiple uses!! Aduhhh. I use it as an eyeshadow, a blush, contour, lipstick...anything you want, really. Don’t wait, you won’t regret it!!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Gorgeous glow and doesn’t disturb makeup
review_content:
I have been a huge fan of cream products recently, but of all the brands and formulas I own, these stand out as the absolute best. I usually like to test out different formulas and don’t often purchase multiple shades of one product, but this was so good that I bought it in South Beach, Na Pali Coast, and Portofino. They never disturb any foundation underneath, and blend out so easily to give a gorgeous non-sticky, soft sheen to the cheeks. I love that I can apply the stick directly to my cheeks without picking up my base and I don’t even need a brush or sponge to blend it, it takes seconds with my fingers. South Beach can be used as a pretty peachy-nude blush or a natural bronzer on my pale skin, while the other two are pigmented but natural dusty coral-pink blushes. I don’t even need to wear highlighter when I use these! If you want easy application, glow, and a natural but colorful flush, definitely try these out. Expensive, but worth it for holy grail status.

On my fair complexion with neutral undertones it’s more of a warm browny pink which I’m cool with. It looks great by itself, or dabbed over other colors. If you use it on your eyes, I highly recommend an eye primer first. It makes for a gorgeous crease color. On me it’s an MLBB shade in place of lipstick but I need to wear it under some lip oil or balm for comfort.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Way too much shimmer for a working professional
review_content:
I REALLY wanted to love this as I'm a huge NARS fan - and it was hard for me to accept that a Nars product doesn't work for me - but it just didn't. First of all, like many people mentioned already, it's very shimmery. As someone who wanted this more as a blush than a highlighter, I was disappointed when the pigmentation mostly disappeared into a sheen after blending it with my fingers. Also, the first time I applied this on my face, I applied way too much pressure and it totally dented the top of the stick. I'm used to the Glossier Haloscope formula, which is much more dense/robust and actually is much less glittery than The Multiple. I love the shade that I purchased (Orgasm - such an iconic color), but the texture and the amount of shimmer was just not what I was looking for.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: This works great on top of my creamy foundation. It barely needs any blending and is super simple. It's a nice color too.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I love this product it blends beautifully and I'm able to use it directly from the tube/stick, then blend with my finger tips. The color is perfect for my very light skin and the foundation I wear is a light ivory. It blends in so well and looks so natural I have been asked by friends if I wear a blush? It's hard for older women to wear blush that looks natural, it's usually too "pink" or "rosy" and looks made-up, this is the first blush that truly looks natural on fair skin. I am 76 and wear my make up as naturally as possible for a natural look in other words to enhance but not to cover. Now, I wish Nars would dump the silly names, it's embarrassing at my age to have to ask for "Orgasm"!

review_content: Although I love the color as a blush, this was WAYYYYYY too glittery. Like my face was sparkling and not in a dewy, glowy kind of way either. I had to return this unfortunately.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: The best blush ever! Easy to blend and natural look.

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Bring the tube version back please!!!
review_content: I'm sick that the tube version of this product was discontinued. This is nice, but the creamy version is fantastic! I love the shade and it goes on so well. I'm considering dropping NARS. If they can drop such a great product perhaps they aren't as aware of their customers as they should be. That was a wonderful product.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Powdery, very drying, no staying power. Very disappointing.... sending back.

user_specs: ['Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Love this! Just enough shine. I love the color compliments my cool skin tone.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I am very fair skinned and wanted something that would blend either with or without foundation and didn't make me look glittery...this is it! such a soft healthy glow that looks flawless! I love that i can also add a pop of color to my eyes or lips as well. Definitely a beautiful product I would recommend to everyone

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: This is a stunning blush...I know it is meant also for the lips and eyes but I don't think it would work for me personally in those ways. I love it especially on a clean face without foundation for a simple blush highlight combo everyday. I pat this on directly and then use a sponge to blend out the edges.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Hawaii girl loving the South Beach vibes
review_content:
Obsessed!! For people struggling to use it, apply a bit on your face with clean fingers before foundation so it warms up. After applying foundation and concealer, bronze up and then apply this with a brush. The one thing I’ve learned with cream to powder formulas is that you gotta treat them like powders if you want them to work. It’s such a bomb product- South Beach is great for warmer, golden undertones. I love it mixed with my radiant long wear foundation for a natural, beachy glow. I set with my Mac fix + in gold lite. As the day goes on, it just looks more and more radiant without getting cakey. NARS shades I use in different products for people with similar skin tones- Barcelona or Valencia in foundation Luster or torrid for blush Ginger as concealer Casino bronzer South beach has definitely become my new favorite product!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: LOVE this product! So easy to use and versatile. I live in the Northeast but am originally from Miami. Always traveling to Florida. It’s my go to blush- just a swipe and gentle swirl on my cheeks and voila! It stays put even in the humid climate of Florida. And it lasts a long long time!

review_content: So creamy and amazing on not only cheeks, but lids, lips and on top of cupid's now. Leaves a hint of shine but not greasy. Love!!!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I love the multiple. I frequently use Malibu and I just bought Orgasm. Both are creamy and highly pigmented. Hot Sand was my most recent purchase and the color is awful. It’s not a coral/tangerine color as pictured it’s a pale foundation type shade so I’d avoid this one.
